content: easy slip_stitch mitts by sandra buzza slip stitches are an easy way to create the appearance of complex colour-work while only working with one strand of yarn at a time these mitts are designed for diamond brand highlander 100% highland wool with two variations for the cuff design and both a fingerless and full mitten version on extra cold days the fingerless gloves fit nicely inside the full mitten for extra warmth materials the fingerless mittens need 90-120 y 80-110 m of the main colour and 50-70 y 45-55 m of the contrast colour the full mittens need 120-150 y 110-140 m of the main colour and 70-85 y 65-80 m of the contrast colour circular needle size 3 25 mm us size 3 long enough to knit using the magic loop method or the equivalent size for four needle method if preferred notes instructions are written for magic loop the charts are written for knitting in the round so that all stitches are knit all slipped stitches are slipped as if to purl gauge 26 sts for 4 in stockinette stitch after blocking finished hand size small 7 5 medium 8 0 large 8 5 fingerless mittens cuff with the contrast colour cast on 48 52 56 sts and join in the round being careful not to twist knit 5 rounds of k1 p1 rib start chart a on the 2nd round of the chart this ensures that the first round is knit with the same colour as the rib and then the next round round three of the chart will start with the main colour continue through to the end of the chart and then repeat the chart two more times then repeat rounds 1-5 one more time knit two more rounds continuing with the main colour thumb gusset make sure that your stitches are divided evenly 24 26 28 sts on each side round 1 knit 23 25 27 st place marker m1l k2 m1r place marker knit to end of round round 2 knit round 3 knit to marker slip marker m1l knit to marker m1r slip marker knit to end of round round 4 knit repeat the last two rounds till the are 16 18 20 sts between the markers on the next round knit till the first marker and slip all the stitches between the two markers onto a strand of waste yarn cast on 2 sts using the backward loop method then knit till the end of the round removing all markers continue knitting in stockinette stitch with the main colour till work measures 1 5 2 2 5 or till 1/2 less than desired length change to the contrast colour and knit one round then knit 4 rounds of k1 p1 rib cast of keeping in the rib pattern thumb put the stitches held on the waste yarn back onto the needle and divide them evenly between the needles with the main colour pick up 1 stitch at the
